moves.9... e6 10. Nc3 Na6 11. a3: A proactive move, to restrain the knight and prepare for a possible pawn storm against the king.
moves.11... Qf6 12. O-O h5 13. Bxe6 Nc7 14. Bb: At this point, material is nearly even but Black's king position is a concern.
moves.17... h4 18. Rf3 Rdf8: Black pursues a King side attack.
moves.19. Be3 Qd7 20. a4 a6 21. a5: White gains ground in provoking weakness around the Black King.
moves.21... h3 22. g3: Necessary if risky--white can't afford to open lines of attack.
moves.24. Nd5: White wants to avoid exchanges when his pieces can be actively deployed.
moves.24... Rfe8 25. c4: Tactical, to drive the N off of b5.
moves.28... Qxd3: ?! very risky. While Black needs to recover some material, this opens up lines of attack against the king.
moves.29. Rd1 Qg6 30. b6: !! White can win the exchange with Nf6+, but Black's king is nearly trapped, this wins quickly. The threat is now Nc7+ followed by mate.
